javadoc.name: GroupLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Provides the local service for accessing, adding, deleting, and updating groups. Groups are mostly used in Liferay as a resource container for permissioning and content scoping purposes.

Groups are also the entity to which LayoutSets are generally associated. Since LayoutSets are the parent entities of Layouts (i.e. pages), no entity can have associated pages without also having an associated Group. This relationship can be depicted as ... Layout -> LayoutSet -> Group[type] [-> Entity]. Note, the Entity part is optional.

Group has a "type" definition that is typically identified by two fields of the entity - String className, and int type .

The className field helps create the group's association with other entities (e.g. Organization, User, Company, UserGroup, ... etc.). The value of className is the full name of the entity's class and the primary key of the associated entity instance. A site has className="Group" and has no associated entity.

The type field helps distinguish between a group used strictly for scoping and a group that also has pages (in which case the type is SITE). For a list of types, see {@link GroupConstants}.

Here is a listing of how Group is related to some portal entities ...

  • Site is a Group with className="Group"
  • Company has 1 Group (this is the global scope, but never has pages)
  • User has 1 Group (pages are optional based on the behavior configuration for personal pages)
  • Layout Template (LayoutPrototype) has 1 Group which uses only 1 of it's 2 LayoutSets to store a single page which can later be used to derive a single page in any Site
  • Site Template (LayoutSetPrototype) has 1 Group which uses only 1 of it's 2 LayoutSets to store many pages which can later be used to derive entire Sites or pulled into an existing Site
  • Organization has 1 Group, but can also be associated to a Site at any point in it's life cycle in order to support having pages
  • UserGroup has 1 Group that can have pages in both of the group's LayoutSets which are later inherited by users assigned to the UserGroup
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Alexander Chow
Bruno Farache
Wesley Gong

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the company's groups, optionally including the user's inherited organization groups and user groups. System and staged groups are not included.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder params (optionally null). To include a user's organizations, inherited organizations, and user groups in the search, add an entry with key "usersGroups" mapped to the user's ID and an entry with key "inherit" mapped to a non-null object. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.GroupFinder}.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of groups to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of groups to return (not inclusive)

return.comment: the matching groups ordered by name

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the groups belonging to the parent group that match the class name IDs and keywords, optionally including the user's inherited organization groups and user groups. System and staged groups are not included.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

javadoc.name: GroupServiceImpl
javadoc.comment: Provides the remote service for accessing, adding, deleting, and updating groups. Its methods include permission checks. Groups are mostly used in Liferay as a resource container for permissioning and content scoping purposes.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan

method.name: addGroup
method.comment: Adds a group.

param.name: parentGroupId
param.comment: the primary key of the parent group

param.name: liveGroupId
param.comment: the primary key of the live group

param.name: name
param.comment: the entity's name

param.name: description
param.comment: the group's description (optionally null)

param.name: type
param.comment: the group's type. For more information see {@link GroupConstants}.

param.name: manualMembership
param.comment: whether manual membership is allowed for the group

param.name: membershipRestriction
param.comment: the group's membership restriction. For more information see {@link GroupConstants}.

param.name: friendlyURL
param.comment: the group's friendlyURL (optionally null)

param.name: site
param.comment: whether the group is to be associated with a main site

param.name: active
param.comment: whether the group is active

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied (optionally null). Can set the asset category IDs and asset tag names for the group, and can set whether the group is for staging

return.comment: the group

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a portal exception occurred

method.name: getUserOrganizationsGroups
method.comment:
Returns the range of all groups associated with the user's organization groups, including the ancestors of the organization groups, unless portal property organizations.membership.strict is set to true.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of groups to consider

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of groups to consider (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of groups associated with the user's organizations

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a portal exception occurred

method.name: getUserPlaces
method.comment:
Returns the user's groups "sites" associated with the group entity class names, including the Control Panel group if the user is permitted to view the Control Panel.
  • Class name "User" includes the user's layout set group.
  • Class name "Organization" includes the user's immediate organization groups and inherited organization groups.
  • Class name "Group" includes the user's immediate organization groups and site groups.
  • A classNames value of null includes the user's layout set group, organization groups, inherited organization groups, and site groups.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: classNames
param.comment: the group entity class names (optionally null). For more information see {@link #getUserSitesGroups(long, String[], int)}.

param.name: max
param.comment: the maximum number of groups to return

return.comment: the user's groups "sites"

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a portal exception occurred

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the site groups and organization groups that match the name and description, optionally including the user's inherited organization groups and user groups. System and staged groups are not included.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: name
param.comment: the group's name (optionally null)

param.name: description
param.comment: the group's description (optionally null)

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder params (optionally null). To include the user's inherited organizations and user groups in the search, add entries having "usersGroups" and "inherit" as keys mapped to the the user's ID. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.GroupFinder}.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of groups to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of groups to return (not inclusive)

return.comment: the matching groups ordered by name

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a portal exception occurred

param.name: name

param.name: description
param.comment: the group's description (optionally null)

param.name: params

return.comment: the number of matching groups

javadoc.name: LayoutFriendlyURLLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Provides the local service for accessing, adding, deleting, and updating friendly URLs for layouts.

All custom service methods should be put in this class. Whenever methods are added, rerun ServiceBuilder to copy their definitions into the {@link com.liferay.portal.service.LayoutFriendlyURLLocalService} interface.

Methods of this service will not have security checks based on the propagated JAAS credentials because this service can only be accessed from within the same VM.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan

javadoc.name: LayoutLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment: Provides the local service for accessing, adding, deleting, exporting, importing, and updating layouts.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Jorge Ferrer
Joel Kozikowski
Charles May
Raymond Augé
Jorge Ferrer
Bruno Farache
Vilmos Papp
James Lefeu
Tibor Lipusz

method.name: getCounterName
method.comment: Returns the object counter's name.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: privateLayout
param.comment: whether layout is private to the group

return.comment: the object counter's name

method.name: addLayout
method.comment:
Adds a layout.

This method handles the creation of the layout including its resources, metadata, and internal data structures. It is not necessary to make subsequent calls to any methods to setup default groups, resources, ... etc.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: privateLayout
param.comment: whether the layout is private to the group

param.name: parentLayoutId
param.comment: the primary key of the parent layout (optionally {@link LayoutConstants#DEFAULT_PARENT_LAYOUT_ID})

param.name: nameMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized names

param.name: titleMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized titles

param.name: descriptionMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: keywordsMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized keywords

param.name: robotsMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized robots

param.name: type
param.comment: the layout's type (optionally {@link LayoutConstants#TYPE_PORTLET}). The possible types can be found in {@link LayoutConstants}.

param.name: hidden
param.comment: whether the layout is hidden

param.name: friendlyURL
param.comment: the layout's friendly URL (optionally {@link PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PRIVATE_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL} or {@link PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PUBLIC_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL}). The default values can be overridden in portal-ext.properties by specifying new values for the corresponding properties defined in {@link PropsValues}. To see how the URL is normalized when accessed, see {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.FriendlyURLNormalizerUtil#normalize(String)}.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Must set the UUID for the layout. Can set the creation date, modification date and the expando bridge attributes for the layout. For layouts that belong to a layout set prototype, an attribute named layoutUpdateable can be set to specify whether site administrators can modify this page within their site. For layouts that are created from a layout prototype, attributes named layoutPrototypeUuid and layoutPrototypeLinkedEnabled can be specified to provide the unique identifier of the source prototype and a boolean to determine whether a link to it should be enabled to activate propagation of changes made to the linked page in the prototype.

return.comment: the layout

method.deprecated: As of 6.2.0, replaced by {@link #addLayout(long, long, boolean, long, Map, Map, Map, Map, Map, String, String, boolean, Map, ServiceContext)}

param.name: typeSettings

param.name: hidden

param.name: friendlyURLMap

param.comment: the service context to be applied. Must set the UUID for the layout. Can set the creation date, modification date, and expando bridge attributes for the layout. For layouts that belong to a layout set prototype, an attribute named layoutUpdateable can be set to specify whether site administrators can modify this page within their site. For layouts that are created from a layout prototype, attributes named layoutPrototypeUuid and layoutPrototypeLinkedEnabled can be specified to provide the unique identifier of the source prototype and a boolean to determine whether a link to it should be enabled to activate propagation of changes made to the linked page in the prototype.

method.name: addLayout
method.comment:
Adds a layout with single entry maps for name, title, and description to the default locale.

This method handles the creation of the layout including its resources, metadata, and internal data structures. It is not necessary to make subsequent calls to any methods to setup default groups, resources, ... etc.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: privateLayout

param.name: parentLayoutId
param.comment: the primary key of the parent layout (optionally {@link LayoutConstants#DEFAULT_PARENT_LAYOUT_ID}). The possible values can be found in {@link LayoutConstants}.

param.name: name
param.comment: the layout's name (optionally {@link PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PRIVATE_LAYOUT_NAME} or {@link PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PUBLIC_LAYOUT_NAME}). The default values can be overridden in portal-ext.properties by specifying new values for the corresponding properties defined in {@link PropsValues}

param.name: title
param.comment: the layout's title

param.name: description
param.comment: the layout's description

param.name: type
param.comment: the layout's type (optionally {@link LayoutConstants#TYPE_PORTLET}). The possible types can be found in {@link LayoutConstants}.

param.name: hidden
param.comment: whether the layout is hidden

param.name: friendlyURL
param.comment: the friendly URL of the layout (optionally {@link PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PRIVATE_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL} or {@link PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PUBLIC_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL}). The default values can be overridden in portal-ext.properties by specifying new values for the corresponding properties defined in {@link PropsValues}. To see how the URL is normalized when accessed, see {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.FriendlyURLNormalizerUtil#normalize(String)}.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Must set the UUID for the layout. Can set the creation date and modification date for the layout. For layouts that belong to a layout set prototype, an attribute named layoutUpdateable can be set to specify whether site administrators can modify this page within their site.

return.comment: the layout

method.name: getLayouts
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the layouts belonging to the group that are children of the parent layout.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: privateLayout
param.comment: whether the layout is private to the group

param.name: parentLayoutId
param.comment: the primary key of the parent layout

param.name: incomplete
param.comment: whether the layout is incomplete

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of layouts

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of layouts (not inclusive)

return.comment: the matching layouts, or null if no matches were found

method.name: updateLayout
method.comment: Updates the layout.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: privateLayout
param.comment: whether the layout is private to the group

param.name: layoutId
param.comment: the primary key of the layout

param.name: parentLayoutId
param.comment: the primary key of the layout's new parent layout

param.name: nameMap
param.comment: the locales and localized names to merge (optionally null)

param.name: titleMap
param.comment: the locales and localized titles to merge (optionally null)

param.name: descriptionMap
param.comment: the locales and localized descriptions to merge (optionally null)

param.name: keywordsMap
param.comment: the locales and localized keywords to merge (optionally null)

param.name: robotsMap
param.comment: the locales and localized robots to merge (optionally null)

param.name: type
param.comment: the layout's new type (optionally {@link LayoutConstants#TYPE_PORTLET})

param.name: hidden
param.comment: whether the layout is hidden

param.name: friendlyURLMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized friendly URLs. To see how the URL is normalized when accessed, see {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.FriendlyURLNormalizerUtil#normalize(String)}.

param.name: iconImage
param.comment: whether the icon image will be updated

param.name: iconBytes
param.comment: the byte array of the layout's new icon image

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Can set the modification date and expando bridge attributes for the layout. For layouts that are linked to a layout prototype, attributes named layoutPrototypeUuid and layoutPrototypeLinkedEnabled can be specified to provide the unique identifier of the source prototype and a boolean to determine whether a link to it should be enabled to activate propagation of changes made to the linked page in the prototype.

return.comment: the updated layout

The default values can be overridden in portal-ext.properties by specifying new values for the corresponding properties defined in {@link PropsValues}. To see how the URL is normalized when accessed, see {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.FriendlyURLNormalizerUtil#normalize(String)}.

javadoc.name: LayoutServiceImpl
javadoc.comment: Provides the remote service for accessing, adding, deleting, exporting, importing, scheduling publishing of, and updating layouts. Its methods include permission checks.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Wesley Gong
Tibor Lipusz

method.name: addLayout
method.comment:
Adds a layout with additional parameters.

This method handles the creation of the layout including its resources, metadata, and internal data structures. It is not necessary to make subsequent calls to any methods to setup default groups, resources, ... etc.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: privateLayout
param.comment: whether the layout is private to the group

param.name: parentLayoutId
param.comment: the primary key of the parent layout (optionally {@link LayoutConstants#DEFAULT_PARENT_LAYOUT_ID})

param.name: localeNamesMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized names

param.name: localeTitlesMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized titles

param.name: descriptionMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: keywordsMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized keywords

param.name: robotsMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized robots

param.name: type
param.comment: the layout's type (optionally {@link LayoutConstants#TYPE_PORTLET}). The possible types can be found in {@link LayoutConstants}.

param.name: hidden
param.comment: whether the layout is hidden

param.name: friendlyURL
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized friendly URLs. To see how the URL is normalized when accessed, see {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.FriendlyURLNormalizerUtil#normalize(String)}.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Must set the UUID for the layout. Can set the creation date, modification date, and expando bridge attributes for the layout. For layouts that belong to a layout set prototype, an attribute named layoutUpdateable can be used to specify whether site administrators can modify this page within their site.

return.comment: the layout

method.deprecated: As of 6.2.0, replaced by {@link #addLayout(long, boolean, long, Map, Map, Map, Map, Map, String, String, boolean, Map, ServiceContext)}

method.name: addLayout
method.comment:
Adds a layout with single entry maps for name, title, and description to the default locale.

This method handles the creation of the layout including its resources, metadata, and internal data structures. It is not necessary to make subsequent calls to any methods to setup default groups, resources, ... etc.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: privateLayout
param.comment: whether the layout is private to the group

param.name: parentLayoutId
param.comment: the primary key of the parent layout (optionally {@link LayoutConstants#DEFAULT_PARENT_LAYOUT_ID})

param.name: name
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized names

param.name: title
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized titles

param.name: description
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: type
param.comment: the layout's type (optionally {@link LayoutConstants#TYPE_PORTLET}). The possible types can be found in {@link LayoutConstants}.

param.name: hidden
param.comment: whether the layout is hidden

param.name: friendlyURL
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized friendly URLs. To see how the URL is normalized when accessed, see {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.FriendlyURLNormalizerUtil#normalize(String)}.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Must set the UUID for the layout. Can specify the creation date, modification date, and expando bridge attributes for the layout. For layouts that belong to a layout set prototype, an attribute named layoutUpdateable can be used to specify whether site administrators can modify this page within their site.

return.comment: the layout

method.name: updateLayoutSetPrototypeLinkEnabled
method.comment:
Updates the state of the layout set prototype link.

This method can disable the layout set prototype's link by setting layoutSetPrototypeLinkEnabled to false. However, this method can only enable the layout set prototype's link if the layout set prototype's current uuid is not null. Setting the layoutSetPrototypeLinkEnabled to true when the layout set prototype's current uuid is null will have no effect.

method.name: getUserOrganizationIds
method.comment:
Returns all the IDs of organizations with which the user is explicitly associated, optionally including the IDs of organizations that the user administers or owns.

A user is considered to be explicitly associated with an organization if his account is individually created within the organization or if the user is later added to it.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: includeAdministrative
param.comment: whether to include the IDs of organizations that the user administers or owns, even if he's not a member of the organizations

return.comment: the IDs of organizations with which the user is explicitly associated, optionally including the IDs of organizations that the user administers or owns

method.name: getUserOrganizations
method.comment:
Returns all the organizations with which the user is explicitly associated, optionally including the organizations that the user administers or owns.

A user is considered to be explicitly associated with an organization if his account is individually created within the organization or if the user is later added as a member.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: includeAdministrative
param.comment: whether to include the IDs of organizations that the user administers or owns, even if he's not a member of the organizations

return.comment: the organizations with which the user is explicitly associated, optionally including the organizations that the user administers or owns

param.comment: the primary key of the password policy

param.name: organizationId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization

return.comment: true if the password policy has been assigned to the organization; false otherwise

method.name: hasUserOrganization
method.comment:
Returns true if the user is a member of the organization, optionally focusing on suborganizations or the specified organization. This method is usually called to determine if the user has view access to a resource belonging to the organization.
  1. If inheritSuborganizations=false: the method checks whether the user belongs to the organization specified by organizationId. The parameter includeSpecifiedOrganization is ignored.
  2. The parameter includeSpecifiedOrganization is ignored unless inheritSuborganizations is also true.
  3. If inheritSuborganizations=true and includeSpecifiedOrganization=false: the method checks whether the user belongs to one of the child organizations of the one specified by organizationId.
  4. If inheritSuborganizations=true and includeSpecifiedOrganization=true: the method checks whether the user belongs to the organization specified by organizationId or any of its child organizations.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization's user

param.name: organizationId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization

param.name: inheritSuborganizations
param.comment: if true suborganizations are considered in the determination

param.name: includeSpecifiedOrganization
param.comment: if true the organization specified by organizationId is considered in the determination

return.comment: true if the user has access to the organization; false otherwise

method.name: rebuildTree
method.comment:
Rebuilds the organization's tree.

Only call this method if the tree has become stale through operations other than normal CRUD. Under normal circumstances the tree is automatically rebuilt whenever necessary.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization's company

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the organizations that match the keywords, using the indexer. It is preferable to use this method instead of the non-indexed version whenever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization's company

param.name: parentOrganizationId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization's parent organization

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the organization's name, street, city, zipcode, type, region or country (optionally null)

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder parameters (optionally null). For more information see {@link com.liferay.portlet.usersadmin.util.OrganizationIndexer}

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of organizations to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of organizations to return (not inclusive)

param.name: sort
param.comment: the field and direction by which to sort (optionally null)

return.comment: the matching organizations ordered by name

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns a name ordered range of all the organizations that match the keywords, type, region, and country, without using the indexer. It is preferable to use the indexed version {@link #search(long, long, String, LinkedHashMap, int, int, Sort)} instead of this method wherever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.comment: the primary key of the organization's company

param.name: type
param.comment: the organization's type (optionally null)

param.name: regionId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization's region (optionally null)

param.name: countryId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization's country (optionally null)

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder params. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.OrganizationFinder}

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of organizations to return

param.name: end

return.comment: the matching organizations ordered by name

method.name: getOrganizations
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the organizations belonging to the parent organization.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the organizations' company

param.name: parentOrganizationId
param.comment: the primary key of the organizations' parent organization

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of organizations to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of organizations to return (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of organizations belonging to the parent organization

method.name: getOrganizationsCount
method.comment: Returns the number of organizations belonging to the parent organization.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the organizations' company

param.name: parentOrganizationId
param.comment: the primary key of the organizations' parent organization

return.comment: the number of organizations belonging to the parent organization

method.name: getUserOrganizations
method.comment:
Returns all the organizations with which the user is explicitly associated.

A user is considered to be explicitly associated with an organization if his account is individually created within the organization or if the user is later added as a member.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

return.comment: the organizations with which the user is explicitly associated

method.comment: Adds a resource block if necessary and associates the resource block permissions with it. The resource block will have an initial reference count of one.

param.comment: the primary key of the resource block's company

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the resource block's group

param.name: name
param.comment: the resource block's name

param.comment: the resource block's permission hash

param.name: resourceBlockPermissionsContainer
param.comment: the resource block's permissions container

return.comment: the new resource block

method.name: releaseResourceBlock
method.comment: Decrements the reference count of the resource block and updates it in the database or deletes the resource block if the reference count reaches zero.

param.name: resourceBlockId
param.comment: the primary key of the resource block

javadoc.name: ResourceLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Provides the local service for accessing, adding, and updating resources.

Permissions in Liferay are defined for resource/action pairs. Some resources, known as portlet resources, define actions that the end-user can perform with respect to a portlet window. Other resources, known as model resources, define actions that the end-user can perform with respect to the service/persistence layer.

On creating an entity instance, you should create resources for it. The following example demonstrates adding resources for an instance of a model entity named SomeWidget. The IDs of the actions permitted for the group and guests are passed in from the service context. 


resourceLocalService.addModelResources(
		SomeWidget.getCompanyId(), SomeWidget.getGroupId(), userId,
		SomeWidget.class.getName(), SomeWidget.getPrimaryKey(),
		serviceContext.getGroupPermissions, serviceContext.getGuestPermissions);

Just prior to deleting an entity instance, you should delete its resource at the individual scope. The following example demonstrates deleting a resource associated with the SomeWidget model entity at the scope individual scope. 


resourceLocalService.deleteResource(
		SomeWidget.getCompanyId(), SomeWidget.class.getName(),
		ResourceConstants.SCOPE_INDIVIDUAL, SomeWidget.getPrimaryKey());
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Wilson S. Man
Raymond Augé
Julio Camarero
Connor McKay

method.name: addModelResources
method.comment:
Adds resources for the model, always creating a resource at the individual scope and only creating resources at the group, group template, and company scope if such resources don't already exist.
  1. If the service context specifies that default group or default guest permissions are to be added, then only default permissions are added. See {@link ServiceContext#setAddGroupPermissions( boolean)} and {@link ServiceContext#setAddGuestPermissions( boolean)}.
  2. Else ...
    1. If the service context specifies to derive default permissions, then default group and guest permissions are derived from the model and added. See {@link ServiceContext#setDeriveDefaultPermissions( boolean)}.
    2. Lastly group and guest permissions from the service context are applied. See {@link ServiceContext#setGroupPermissions(String[])} and {@link ServiceContext#setGuestPermissions(String[])}.

param.name: auditedModel
param.comment: the model to associate with the resources

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to apply. Can set whether to add the model's default group and guest permissions, set whether to derive default group and guest permissions from the model, set group permissions to apply, and set guest permissions to apply.

javadoc.name: ResourcePermissionLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Provides the local service for accessing, adding, checking, deleting, granting, and revoking resource permissions.

Before attempting to read any of the documentation for this class, first read {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl} for an explanation of scoping.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Raymond Augé
Connor McKay

method.name: addResourcePermission
method.comment:
Grants the role permission at the scope to perform the action on resources of the type. Existing actions are retained.

This method cannot be used to grant individual scope permissions, but is only intended for adding permissions at the company, group, and group-template scopes. For example, this method could be used to grant a company scope permission to edit message board posts.

If a company scope permission is granted to resources that the role already had group scope permissions to, the group scope permissions are deleted. Likewise, if a group scope permission is granted to resources that the role already had company scope permissions to, the company scope permissions are deleted. Be aware that this latter behavior can result in an overall reduction in permissions for the role.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: name
param.comment: the resource's name, which can be either a class name or a portlet ID

param.name: scope
param.comment: the scope. This method only supports company, group, and group-template scope.

param.name: primKey
param.comment: the primary key

param.name: roleId
param.comment: the primary key of the role

param.name: actionId
param.comment: the action ID

method.name: addResourcePermissions
method.comment:
Grants the role permissions at the scope to perform the actions on all resources of the type. Existing actions are retained.

This method should only be used to add default permissions to existing resources en masse during upgrades or while verifying permissions. For example, this method could be used to grant site members individual scope permissions to view all blog posts.

param.name: resourceName
param.comment: the resource's name, which can be either a class name or a portlet ID

param.name: roleName
param.comment: the role's name

param.name: scope
param.comment: the scope

param.name: resourceActionBitwiseValue
param.comment: the bitwise IDs of the actions

method.name: deleteResourcePermissions
method.comment:
Deletes all resource permissions at the scope to resources of the type. This method should not be confused with any of the removeResourcePermission methods, as its purpose is very different. This method should only be used for deleting resource permissions that refer to a resource when that resource is deleted. For example this method could be used to delete all individual scope permissions to a blog post when it is deleted.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.comment: the scope

param.name: primKey
param.comment: the primary key

method.name: getRoleResourcePermissions
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the resource permissions for the role at the scopes.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: roleId
param.comment: the primary key of the role

param.name: scopes
param.comment: the scopes

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of results

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of results (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of resource permissions for the role at the scopes

method.name: getScopeResourcePermissions
method.comment:
Returns all the resource permissions where scope = any ?.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: scopes
param.comment: the scopes

return.comment: the resource permissions where scope = any ?

This method can be used to set permissions at any scope, but it is generally only used at the individual scope. For example, it could be used to set the guest permissions on a blog post.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

method.comment:
Updates the role's permissions at the scope, either adding to, removing from, or setting the actions that can be performed on resources of the type. Automatically creates a new resource permission if none exists, or deletes the existing resource permission if it no longer grants permissions to perform any action.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: name
param.comment: the resource's name, which can be either a class name or a portlet ID

param.name: scope
param.comment: the scope

param.name: primKey
param.comment: the primary key

param.name: roleId
param.comment: the primary key of the role

param.name: ownerId
param.comment: the primary key of the owner

param.name: actionIds
param.comment: the action IDs of the actions

param.name: operator
param.comment: whether to add to, remove from, or set/replace the existing actions. Possible values can be found in {@link ResourcePermissionConstants}.

javadoc.name: ResourcePermissionServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Provides the remote service for adding, granting, and revoking resource permissions. Its methods include permission checks.

Before attempting to read any of the documentation for this class, first read {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl} for an explanation of scoping.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan

method.name: addResourcePermission
method.comment:
Grants the role permission at the scope to perform the action on resources of the type. Existing actions are retained.

This method cannot be used to grant individual scope permissions, but is only intended for adding permissions at the company, group, and group-template scopes. For example, this method could be used to grant a company scope permission to edit message board posts.

If a company scope permission is granted to resources that the role already had group scope permissions to, the group scope permissions are deleted. Likewise, if a group scope permission is granted to resources that the role already had company scope permissions to, the company scope permissions are deleted. Be aware that this latter behavior can result in an overall reduction in permissions for the role.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: name
param.comment: the resource's name, which can be either a class name or a portlet ID

param.name: scope
param.comment: the scope. This method only supports company, group, and group-template scope.

param.name: primKey
param.comment: the primary key

param.name: roleId
param.comment: the primary key of the role

param.name: actionId
param.comment: the action ID

method.name: removeResourcePermission
method.comment:
Revokes permission at the scope from the role to perform the action on resources of the type. For example, this method could be used to revoke a group scope permission to edit blog posts.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

param.name: roleId
param.comment: the primary key of the role

param.name: actionId
param.comment: the action ID

method.name: removeResourcePermissions
method.comment: Revokes all permissions at the scope from the role to perform the action on resources of the type. For example, this method could be used to revoke all individual scope permissions to edit blog posts from site members.

method.name: setIndividualResourcePermissions
method.comment:
Updates the role's permissions at the scope, setting the actions that can be performed on resources of the type. Existing actions are replaced.

This method can be used to set permissions at any scope, but it is generally only used at the individual scope. For example, it could be used to set the guest permissions on a blog post.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

param.comment: the primary key of the group

javadoc.name: ResourceTypePermissionLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Provides the local service for accessing and updating resource type permissions.

Never call the update methods of this service directly, always go through the resource block local service.
javadoc.author: Connor McKay

The method searches the system roles map first for default roles. If a role with the name is not found, then the method will query the database.

method.name: getDefaultGroupRole
method.comment:
Returns the default role for the group with the primary key.

If the group is a site, then the default role is {@link RoleConstants#SITE_MEMBER}. If the group is an organization, then the default role is {@link RoleConstants#ORGANIZATION_USER}. If the group is a user or user group, then the default role is {@link RoleConstants#POWER_USER}. For all other group types, the default role is {@link RoleConstants#USER}.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

return.comment: the default role for the group with the primary key

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the roles that match the keywords and types.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the role's name or description (optionally null)

param.name: types
param.comment: the role types (optionally null)

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of roles to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of roles to return (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the roles (optionally null)

return.comment: the ordered range of the matching roles, ordered by obc

javadoc.name: SubscriptionLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment: Provides the local service for accessing, adding, and deleting notification subscriptions to entities. It handles subscriptions to entities found in many different places in the portal, including message boards, blogs, and documents and media.
javadoc.author: Charles May
Zsolt Berentey

method.name: addSubscription
method.comment:
Subscribes the user to the entity, notifying him the instant the entity is created, deleted, or modified.

If there is no asset entry with the class name and class PK a new asset entry is created.

A social activity for the subscription is created using the asset entry associated with the class name and class PK, or the newly created asset entry.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the entity's group

param.name: className
param.comment: the entity's class name

param.name: classPK
param.comment: the primary key of the entity's instance

return.comment: the subscription

method.name: addSubscription
method.comment:
Subscribes the user to the entity, notifying him at the given frequency.

If there is no asset entry with the class name and class PK a new asset entry is created.

A social activity for the subscription is created using the asset entry associated with the class name and class PK, or the newly created asset entry.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the entity's group

param.name: className
param.comment: the entity's class name

param.name: classPK
param.comment: the primary key of the entity's instance

param.name: frequency
param.comment: the frequency for notifications

return.comment: the subscription

method.name: deleteSubscription
method.comment: Deletes the subscription with the primary key. A social activity with the unsubscribe action is created.

param.name: subscriptionId
param.comment: the primary key of the subscription

return.comment: the subscription that was removed

method.comment: Deletes the user's subscription to the entity. A social activity with the unsubscribe action is created.

param.comment: the primary key of the entity's instance

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the user groups that match the keywords.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user group's company

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the user group's name or description (optionally null)

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder params (optionally null). For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.UserGroupFinder}

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of user groups to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of user groups to return (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the user groups (optionally null)

return.comment: the matching user groups ordered by comparator obc

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the user groups that match the keywords, using the indexer. It is preferable to use this method instead of the non-indexed version whenever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user group's company

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the user group's name or description (optionally null)

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder params (optionally null). For more information see {@link com.liferay.portlet.usergroupsadmin.util.UserGroupIndexer}

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of user groups to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of user groups to return (not inclusive)

param.name: sort
param.comment: the field and direction by which to sort (optionally null)

return.comment: the matching user groups ordered by sort

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the user groups that match the name and description.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user group's company

param.name: name
param.comment: the user group's name (optionally null)

param.name: description
param.comment: the user group's description (optionally null)

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder params (optionally null). For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.UserGroupFinder}

param.name: andOperator
param.comment: whether every field must match its keywords or just one field

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of user groups to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of user groups to return (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the user groups (optionally null)

return.comment: the matching user groups ordered by comparator obc

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the user groups that match the name and description. It is preferable to use this method instead of the non-indexed version whenever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

This method handles the creation and bookkeeping of the user including its resources, metadata, and internal data structures. It is not necessary to make subsequent calls to any methods to setup default groups, resources, etc.

param.name: creatorUserId
param.comment: the primary key of the creator

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: autoPassword
param.comment: whether a password should be automatically generated for the user

param.name: password1
param.comment: the user's password

param.name: password2
param.comment: the user's password confirmation

param.name: autoScreenName
param.comment: whether a screen name should be automatically generated for the user

param.name: screenName
param.comment: the user's screen name

param.name: emailAddress
param.comment: the user's email address

param.name: facebookId
param.comment: the user's facebook ID

param.name: openId
param.comment: the user's OpenID

param.name: locale
param.comment: the user's locale

param.name: firstName
param.comment: the user's first name

param.name: middleName
param.comment: the user's middle name

param.name: lastName
param.comment: the user's last name

param.name: prefixId
param.comment: the user's name prefix ID

param.name: suffixId
param.comment: the user's name suffix ID

param.name: male
param.comment: whether the user is male

param.name: birthdayMonth
param.comment: the user's birthday month (0-based, meaning 0 for January)

param.name: birthdayDay
param.comment: the user's birthday day

param.name: birthdayYear
param.comment: the user's birthday year

param.name: jobTitle
param.comment: the user's job title

param.name: groupIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the user's groups

param.name: organizationIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the user's organizations

param.name: roleIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the roles this user possesses

param.name: userGroupIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the user's user groups

param.name: sendEmail
param.comment: whether to send the user an email notification about their new account

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied (optionally null). Can set the UUID (with the uuid attribute), asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the user.

return.comment: the new user

param.name: userGroupId
param.comment: the primary key of the user group

param.name: userIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the users

method.name: authenticateByEmailAddress
method.comment: Attempts to authenticate the user by their email address and password, while using the AuthPipeline.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: emailAddress
param.comment: the user's email address

param.name: password
param.comment: the user's password

param.name: headerMap
param.comment: the header map from the authentication request

param.name: parameterMap
param.comment: the parameter map from the authentication request

param.name: resultsMap
param.comment: the map of authentication results (may be nil). After a successful authentication the user's primary key will be placed under the key userId.

return.comment: the authentication status. This can be {@link Authenticator#FAILURE} indicating that the user's credentials are invalid, {@link Authenticator#SUCCESS} indicating a successful login, or {@link Authenticator#DNE} indicating that a user with that login does not exist.

param.name: resultsMap
param.comment: the map of authentication results (may be nil). After a successful authentication the user's primary key will be placed under the key userId.

return.comment: the authentication status. This can be {@link Authenticator#FAILURE} indicating that the user's credentials are invalid, {@link Authenticator#SUCCESS} indicating a successful login, or {@link Authenticator#DNE} indicating that a user with that login does not exist.

method.comment: Attempts to authenticate the user by their primary key and password, while using the AuthPipeline.

param.comment: the parameter map from the authentication request

param.name: resultsMap
param.comment: the map of authentication results (may be nil). After a successful authentication the user's primary key will be placed under the key userId.

return.comment: the authentication status. This can be {@link Authenticator#FAILURE} indicating that the user's credentials are invalid, {@link Authenticator#SUCCESS} indicating a successful login, or {@link Authenticator#DNE} indicating that a user with that login does not exist.

method.name: authenticateForBasic
method.comment:
Attempts to authenticate the user using HTTP basic access authentication, without using the AuthPipeline. Primarily used for authenticating users of tunnel-web.

Authentication type specifies what login contains.The valid values are:

  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_EA - login is the user's email address
  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_SN - login is the user's screen name
  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_ID - login is the user's primary key

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: authType
param.comment: the type of authentication to perform

param.name: login
param.comment: either the user's email address, screen name, or primary key depending on the value of authType

param.name: password
param.comment: the user's password

return.comment: the user's primary key if authentication is successful; 0 otherwise

method.name: authenticateForDigest
method.comment: Attempts to authenticate the user using HTTP digest access authentication, without using the AuthPipeline. Primarily used for authenticating users of tunnel-web.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: username
param.comment: either the user's email address, screen name, or primary key

param.name: realm
param.comment: unused

param.name: nonce
param.comment: the number used once

param.name: method
param.comment: the request method

param.name: uri
param.comment: the request URI

param.name: response
param.comment: the authentication response hash

return.comment: the user's primary key if authentication is successful; 0 otherwise

method.name: authenticateForJAAS
method.comment: Attempts to authenticate the user using JAAS credentials, without using the AuthPipeline.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: encPassword
param.comment: the encrypted password

return.comment: true if authentication is successful; false otherwise

You automatically generate a password for the user by setting attribute autoPassword to true. You can send a confirmation email to the user by setting attribute sendEmail to true.

method.name: getCompanyUsers
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the users belonging to the company.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of users

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of users (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of users belonging to the company

method.name: getSocialUsers
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the users with a social relation of the type with the user.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: socialRelationType
param.comment: the type of social relation. The possible types can be found in {@link SocialRelationConstants}.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of users

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of users (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the users by (optionally null)

return.comment: the ordered range of users with a social relation of the type with the user

method.deprecated: As of 7.0.0, replaced by {@link #getSocialUsers(long, int, String, int, int, OrderByComparator)}

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the users who match the keywords and status, without using the indexer. It is preferable to use the indexed version {@link #search(long, String, int, LinkedHashMap, int, int, Sort)} instead of this method wherever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the user's first name, middle name, last name, screen name, or email address

param.name: status
param.comment: the workflow status

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder parameters (optionally null). For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.UserFinder}.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of users

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of users (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the users by (optionally null)

return.comment: the matching users

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the users with the status, and whose first name, middle name, last name, screen name, and email address match the keywords specified for them, without using the indexer. It is preferable to use the indexed version {@link #search(long, String, String, String, String, String, int, LinkedHashMap, boolean, int, int, Sort)} instead of this method wherever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: status
param.comment: the workflow status

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder parameters (optionally null). For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.UserFinder}.

param.name: andSearch
param.comment: whether every field must match its keywords, or just one field. For example, "users with the first name 'bob' and last name 'smith'" vs "users with the first name 'bob' or the last name 'smith'".

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of users

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of users (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the users by (optionally null)

return.comment: the matching users

method.name: sendPassword

param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: emailAddress
param.comment: the user's email address

param.name: fromAddress
param.comment: the address of the individual that the email should be from

param.name: subject
param.comment: the email subject. If null, the subject specified in portal.properties will be used.

param.name: body
param.comment: the email body. If null, the body specified in portal.properties will be used.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied

method.name: sendPasswordByEmailAddress
method.comment:
Sends a password notification email to the user matching the email address. The portal's settings determine whether a password is sent explicitly or whether a link for resetting the user's password is sent. The method sends the email asynchronously and returns before the email is sent.

The content of the notification email is specified with the admin.email.password portal property keys. They can be overridden via a portal-ext.properties file or modified through the Portal Settings UI.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: emailAddress
param.comment: the user's email address

return.comment: true if the notification email includes a new password; false if the notification email only contains a reset link

method.name: sendPasswordByScreenName
method.comment:
Sends a password notification email to the user matching the screen name. The portal's settings determine whether a password is sent explicitly or whether a link for resetting the user's password is sent. The method sends the email asynchronously and returns before the email is sent.

The content of the notification email is specified with the admin.email.password portal property keys. They can be overridden via a portal-ext.properties file or modified through the Portal Settings UI.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: screenName
param.comment: the user's screen name

return.comment: true if the notification email includes a new password; false if the notification email only contains a reset link

method.name: sendPasswordByUserId
method.comment:
Sends a password notification email to the user matching the ID. The portal's settings determine whether a password is sent explicitly or whether a link for resetting the user's password is sent. The method sends the email asynchronously and returns before the email is sent.

The content of the notification email is specified with the admin.email.password portal property keys. They can be overridden via a portal-ext.properties file or modified through the Portal Settings UI.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the user's primary key

return.comment: true if the notification email includes a new password; false if the notification email only contains a reset link

method.name: authenticate
method.comment:
Attempts to authenticate the user by their login and password, while using the AuthPipeline.

Authentication type specifies what login contains.The valid values are:

  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_EA - login is the user's email address
  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_SN - login is the user's screen name
  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_ID - login is the user's primary key

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: login
param.comment: either the user's email address, screen name, or primary key depending on the value of authType

param.name: password
param.comment: the user's password

param.name: authType
param.comment: the type of authentication to perform

param.name: headerMap
param.comment: the header map from the authentication request

param.name: parameterMap
param.comment: the parameter map from the authentication request

param.name: resultsMap
param.comment: the map of authentication results (may be nil). After a successful authentication the user's primary key will be placed under the key userId.

return.comment: the authentication status. This can be {@link Authenticator#FAILURE} indicating that the user's credentials are invalid, {@link Authenticator#SUCCESS} indicating a successful login, or {@link Authenticator#DNE} indicating that a user with that login does not exist.

method.name: sendPasswordByEmailAddress
method.comment:
Sends a password notification email to the user matching the email address. The portal's settings determine whether a password is sent explicitly or whether a link for resetting the user's password is sent. The method sends the email asynchronously and returns before the email is sent.

The content of the notification email is specified with the admin.email.password portal property keys. They can be overridden via a portal-ext.properties file or modified through the Portal Settings UI.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: emailAddress
param.comment: the user's email address

return.comment: true if the notification email includes a new password; false if the notification email only contains a reset link

method.name: sendPasswordByScreenName
method.comment:
Sends a password notification email to the user matching the screen name. The portal's settings determine whether a password is sent explicitly or whether a link for resetting the user's password is sent. The method sends the email asynchronously and returns before the email is sent.

The content of the notification email is specified with the admin.email.password portal property keys. They can be overridden via a portal-ext.properties file or modified through the Portal Settings UI.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: screenName
param.comment: the user's screen name

return.comment: true if the notification email includes a new password; false if the notification email only contains a reset link

method.name: sendPasswordByUserId
method.comment:
Sends a password notification email to the user matching the ID. The portal's settings determine whether a password is sent explicitly or whether a link for resetting the user's password is sent. The method sends the email asynchronously and returns before the email is sent.

The content of the notification email is specified with the admin.email.password portal property keys. They can be overridden via a portal-ext.properties file or modified through the Portal Settings UI.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the user's primary key

return.comment: true if the notification email includes a new password; false if the notification email only contains a reset link

javadoc.name: AssetLinkLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
This class implements the methods needed to handle AssetLinks, the entity that relates different assets in the portal.
The basic information stored for every link includes both assets entry IDs, the userId, the link type and the link's weight.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Juan Fernández

method.name: addLink
method.comment: Adds a new asset link.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the link's creator

param.name: entryId1
param.comment: the primary key of the first asset entry

param.name: entryId2
param.comment: the primary key of the second asset entry

param.name: type
param.comment: the link type. Acceptable values include {@link AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_RELATED} which is a bidirectional relationship and {@link AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_CHILD} which is a unidirectional relationship. For more information see {@link AssetLinkConstants}

param.name: weight
param.comment: the weight of the relationship, allowing precedence ordering of links

return.comment: the asset link

method.name: deleteLink
method.comment: Deletes the asset link.

param.name: link
param.comment: the asset link

method.name: deleteLink
method.comment: Deletes the asset link.

param.name: linkId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset link

method.name: deleteLinks
method.comment: Deletes all links associated with the asset entry.

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry

method.name: deleteLinks
method.comment: Delete all links that associate the two asset entries.

param.name: entryId1
param.comment: the primary key of the first asset entry

param.name: entryId2
param.comment: the primary key of the second asset entry

method.name: getDirectLinks
method.comment: Returns all the asset links whose first entry ID is the given entry ID.

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry

return.comment: the asset links whose first entry ID is the given entry ID

method.name: getDirectLinks
method.comment: Returns all the asset links of the given link type whose first entry ID is the given entry ID.

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry

param.name: typeId
param.comment: the link type. Acceptable values include {@link AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_RELATED} which is a bidirectional relationship and {@link AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_CHILD} which is a unidirectional relationship. For more information see {@link AssetLinkConstants}

return.comment: the asset links of the given link type whose first entry ID is the given entry ID

method.name: getLinks
method.comment: Returns all the asset links whose first or second entry ID is the given entry ID.

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry

return.comment: the asset links whose first or second entry ID is the given entry ID

method.name: getLinks
method.comment: Returns all the asset links of the given link type whose first or second entry ID is the given entry ID.

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry

param.name: typeId
param.comment: the link type. Acceptable values include {@link AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_RELATED} which is a bidirectional relationship and {@link AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_CHILD} which is a unidirectional relationship. For more information see {@link AssetLinkConstants}

return.comment: the asset links of the given link type whose first or second entry ID is the given entry ID

method.name: getReverseLinks
method.comment: Returns all the asset links of the given link type whose second entry ID is the given entry ID.

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry

param.name: typeId
param.comment: the link type. Acceptable values include {@link AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_RELATED} which is a bidirectional relationship and {@link AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_CHILD} which is a unidirectional relationship. For more information see {@link AssetLinkConstants}

return.comment: the asset links of the given link type whose second entry ID is the given entry ID

method.name: updateLinks
method.comment:
Updates all links of the asset entry, replacing them with links associating the asset entry with the asset entries of the given link entry IDs.

If no link exists with a given link entry ID, a new link is created associating the current asset entry with the asset entry of that link entry ID. An existing link is deleted if either of its entry IDs is not contained in the given link entry IDs.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user updating the links

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry to be managed

param.name: linkEntryIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the asset entries to be linked with the asset entry to be managed

param.name: typeId
param.comment: the type of the asset links to be created. Acceptable values include {@link AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_RELATED} which is a bidirectional relationship and {@link AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_CHILD} which is a unidirectional relationship. For more information see {@link AssetLinkConstants}

method.name: addTag

method.name: checkTags
method.comment:
Returns the asset tags matching the group and names, creating new asset tags matching the names if the group doesn't already have them.

For each name, if an asset tag with the name doesn't already exist in the group, this method creates a new asset tag with the name in the group.

param.name: userId

param.name: group
param.comment: the group in which to check the asset tags

param.name: names
param.comment: the asset tag names

return.comment: the asset tags matching the group and names and new asset tags matching the names that don't already exist in the group

method.name: getTagStats
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the asset tag statistics instances associated with the asset entry matching the class name ID.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.comment: the asset entry's class name ID

param.comment: the upper bound of the range of results (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of asset tag statistics associated with the asset entry matching the class name ID
