javadoc.name: DLAppLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Provides the local service for accessing, adding, deleting, moving, subscription handling of, and updating document library file entries, file ranks, and folders. All portlets should interact with the document library through this class or through DLAppService, rather than through the individual document library service classes.

This class provides a unified interface to all Liferay and third party repositories. While the method signatures are universal for all repositories. Additional implementation-specific parameters may be specified in the serviceContext.

The repositoryId parameter used by most of the methods is the primary key of the specific repository. If the repository is a default Liferay repository, the repositoryId is the groupId or scopeGroupId. Otherwise, the repositoryId will correspond to values obtained from {@link com.liferay.portal.service.RepositoryLocalServiceUtil}.
javadoc.author: Alexander Chow
Mika Koivisto

method.name: addFileEntry
method.comment:
Adds a file entry and associated metadata based on a byte array.

This method takes two file names, the sourceFileName and the title. The sourceFileName corresponds to the name of the actual file being uploaded. The title corresponds to a name the client wishes to assign this file after it has been uploaded to the portal. If it is null, the sourceFileName will be used.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's creator/owner

param.name: repositoryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's repository

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's parent folder

param.name: sourceFileName
param.comment: the original file's name

param.name: mimeType
param.comment: the file's MIME type

param.name: title
param.comment: the name to be assigned to the file (optionally null )

param.name: description
param.comment: the file's description

param.name: changeLog
param.comment: the file's version change log

param.name: bytes
param.comment: the file's data (optionally null)

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment:
the service context to be applied. Can set the asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the file entry. In a Liferay repository, it may include:
  • fileEntryTypeId - ID for a custom file entry type
  • fieldsMap - mapping for fields associated with a custom file entry type

return.comment: the file entry

method.comment:
Adds a file entry and associated metadata based on a {@link File} object.

This method takes two file names, the sourceFileName and the title. The sourceFileName corresponds to the name of the actual file being uploaded. The title corresponds to a name the client wishes to assign this file after it has been uploaded to the portal. If it is null, the sourceFileName will be used.

param.name: mimeType
param.comment: the file's MIME type

param.name: title
param.comment: the name to be assigned to the file (optionally null )

param.name: description
param.comment: the file's description

param.name: changeLog
param.comment: the file's version change log

param.name: file
param.comment: the file's data (optionally null)

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment:
the service context to be applied. Can set the asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the file entry. In a Liferay repository, it may include:
  • fileEntryTypeId - ID for a custom file entry type
  • fieldsMap - mapping for fields associated with a custom file entry type

return.comment: the file entry

param.comment:
the service context to be applied. In a Liferay repository, it may include:
  • defaultFileEntryTypeId - the file entry type to default all Liferay file entries to
  • dlFileEntryTypesSearchContainerPrimaryKeys - a comma-delimited list of file entry type primary keys allowed in the given folder and all descendants
  • restrictionType - specifying restriction type of file entry types allowed
  • workflowDefinitionXYZ - the workflow definition name specified per file entry type. The parameter name must be the string workflowDefinition appended by the fileEntryTypeId (optionally 0).

return.comment: the folder

javadoc.name: DLAppServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Provides the remote service for accessing, adding, checking in/out, deleting, locking/unlocking, moving, subscription handling of, trash handling of, updating, and verifying document library file entries and folders. Its methods include permission checks. All portlets should interact with the document library through this class or through DLAppLocalService, rather than through the individual document library service classes.

This class provides a unified interface to all Liferay and third party repositories. While the method signatures are universal for all repositories. Additional implementation-specific parameters may be specified in the serviceContext.

The repositoryId parameter used by most of the methods is the primary key of the specific repository. If the repository is a default Liferay repository, the repositoryId is the groupId or scopeGroupId. Otherwise, the repositoryId will correspond to values obtained from {@link com.liferay.portal.service.RepositoryServiceUtil}.
javadoc.author: Alexander Chow
Mika Koivisto
Shuyang Zhou

method.name: cancelCheckOut
method.comment:
Cancels the check out of the file entry. If a user has not checked out the specified file entry, invoking this method will result in no changes.

When a file entry is checked out, a PWC (private working copy) is created and the original file entry is locked. A client can make as many changes to the PWC as he desires without those changes being visible to other users. If the user is satisfied with the changes, he may elect to check in his changes, resulting in a new file version based on the PWC; the PWC will be removed and the file entry will be unlocked. If the user is not satisfied with the changes, he may elect to cancel his check out; this results in the deletion of the PWC and unlocking of the file entry.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry to cancel the checkout

method.name: checkInFileEntry
method.comment:
Checks in the file entry. If a user has not checked out the specified file entry, invoking this method will result in no changes.

When a file entry is checked out, a PWC (private working copy) is created and the original file entry is locked. A client can make as many changes to the PWC as he desires without those changes being visible to other users. If the user is satisfied with the changes, he may elect to check in his changes, resulting in a new file version based on the PWC; the PWC will be removed and the file entry will be unlocked. If the user is not satisfied with the changes, he may elect to cancel his check out; this results in the deletion of the PWC and unlocking of the file entry.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry to check in

param.name: majorVersion
param.comment: whether the new file version is a major version

param.name: changeLog
param.comment: the file's version change log

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied

method.comment:
Checks in the file entry using the lock's UUID. If a user has not checked out the specified file entry, invoking this method will result in no changes. This method is primarily used by WebDAV.

When a file entry is checked out, a PWC (private working copy) is created and the original file entry is locked. A client can make as many changes to the PWC as he desires without those changes being visible to other users. If the user is satisfied with the changes, he may elect to check in his changes, resulting in a new file version based on the PWC; the PWC will be removed and the file entry will be unlocked. If the user is not satisfied with the changes, he may elect to cancel his check out; this results in the deletion of the PWC and unlocking of the file entry.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry to check in

param.name: lockUuid
param.comment: the lock's UUID

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied

method.name: checkOutFileEntry
method.comment:
Check out a file entry.

When a file entry is checked out, a PWC (private working copy) is created and the original file entry is locked. A client can make as many changes to the PWC as he desires without those changes being visible to other users. If the user is satisfied with the changes, he may elect to check in his changes, resulting in a new file version based on the PWC; the PWC will be removed and the file entry will be unlocked. If the user is not satisfied with the changes, he may elect to cancel his check out; this results in the deletion of the PWC and unlocking of the file entry.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the file entry to check out

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied

method.name: checkOutFileEntry
method.comment:
Checks out the file entry. This method is primarily used by WebDAV.

When a file entry is checked out, a PWC (private working copy) is created and the original file entry is locked. A client can make as many changes to the PWC as he desires without those changes being visible to other users. If the user is satisfied with the changes, he may elect to check in his changes, resulting in a new file version based on the PWC; the PWC will be removed and the file entry will be unlocked. If the user is not satisfied with the changes, he may elect to cancel his check out; this results in the deletion of the PWC and unlocking of the file entry.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the file entry to check out

param.name: owner
param.comment: the owner string for the checkout (optionally null)

param.name: expirationTime
param.comment: the time in milliseconds before the lock expires. If the value is 0, the default expiration time will be used from portal.properties>.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied

return.comment: the file entry

method.name: getFileEntries
method.comment:
Returns a name-ordered range of all the file entries in the folder.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: repositoryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's repository

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's folder

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of results

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of results (not inclusive)

return.comment: the name-ordered range of file entries in the folder

method.name: getFileEntries
method.comment:

param.name: folderId

param.name: start

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of results (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the file entries (optionally null)

return.comment: the range of file entries in the folder ordered by comparator obc

method.name: getFolders
method.comment:

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

method.name: getGroupFileEntries
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the file entries in the group starting at the repository default parent folder that are stored within the Liferay repository. This method is primarily used to search for recently modified file entries. It can be limited to the file entries modified by a given user.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user who created the file (optionally 0)

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of results

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of results (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of matching file entries ordered by date modified

method.name: updateFileEntry
method.comment:
Updates a file entry and associated metadata based on a byte array object. If the file data is null, then only the associated metadata (i.e., title, description, and parameters in the serviceContext) will be updated.

This method takes two file names, the sourceFileName and the title. The sourceFileName corresponds to the name of the actual file being uploaded. The title corresponds to a name the client wishes to assign this file after it has been uploaded to the portal.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry

param.name: sourceFileName
param.comment: the original file's name (optionally null)

param.name: mimeType
param.comment: the file's MIME type (optionally null)

param.name: title
param.comment: the new name to be assigned to the file (optionally null)

param.name: description
param.comment: the file's new description

param.name: changeLog
param.comment: the file's version change log (optionally null)

param.name: majorVersion
param.comment: whether the new file version is a major version

param.name: bytes
param.comment: the file's data (optionally null)

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment:
the service context to be applied. Can set the asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the file entry. In a Liferay repository, it may include:
  • fileEntryTypeId - ID for a custom file entry type
  • fieldsMap - mapping for fields associated with a custom file entry type

return.comment: the file entry

method.name: updateFileEntry
method.comment:
Updates a file entry and associated metadata based on a {@link File} object. If the file data is null, then only the associated metadata (i.e., title, description, and parameters in the serviceContext) will be updated.

This method takes two file names, the sourceFileName and the title. The sourceFileName corresponds to the name of the actual file being uploaded. The title corresponds to a name the client wishes to assign this file after it has been uploaded to the portal.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry

param.name: sourceFileName
param.comment: the original file's name (optionally null)

param.name: mimeType
param.comment: the file's MIME type (optionally null)

param.name: title
param.comment: the new name to be assigned to the file (optionally null)

param.name: description
param.comment: the file's new description

param.name: changeLog
param.comment: the file's version change log (optionally null)

param.name: majorVersion
param.comment: whether the new file version is a major version

param.name: file
param.comment: the file's data (optionally null)

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment:
the service context to be applied. Can set the asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the file entry. In a Liferay repository, it may include:
  • fileEntryTypeId - ID for a custom file entry type
  • fieldsMap - mapping for fields associated with a custom file entry type

return.comment: the file entry

method.name: updateFileEntry
method.comment:
Updates a file entry and associated metadata based on an {@link InputStream} object. If the file data is null, then only the associated metadata (i.e., title, description, and parameters in the serviceContext) will be updated.

This method takes two file names, the sourceFileName and the title. The sourceFileName corresponds to the name of the actual file being uploaded. The title corresponds to a name the client wishes to assign this file after it has been uploaded to the portal.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry

param.name: sourceFileName
param.comment: the original file's name (optionally null)

param.name: mimeType
param.comment: the file's MIME type (optionally null)

param.name: title
param.comment: the new name to be assigned to the file (optionally null)

param.name: description
param.comment: the file's new description

param.name: changeLog
param.comment: the file's version change log (optionally null)

param.name: majorVersion
param.comment: whether the new file version is a major version

param.name: is
param.comment: the file's data (optionally null)

param.name: size
param.comment: the file's size (optionally 0)

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment:
the service context to be applied. Can set the asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the file entry. In a Liferay repository, it may include:
  • fileEntryTypeId - ID for a custom file entry type
  • fieldsMap - mapping for fields associated with a custom file entry type

return.comment: the file entry

method.name: updateFileShortcut
method.comment: Updates a file shortcut to the existing file entry. This method is only supported by the Liferay repository.

param.name: fileShortcutId
param.comment: the primary key of the file shortcut

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the file shortcut's parent folder

param.name: toFileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file shortcut's file entry

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Can set the asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the file entry.

return.comment: the file shortcut

method.name: updateFolder
method.comment: Updates the folder.

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the folder

param.name: name
param.comment: the folder's new name

param.name: description
param.comment: the folder's new description

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment:
the service context to be applied. In a Liferay repository, it may include:
  • defaultFileEntryTypeId - the file entry type to default all Liferay file entries to
  • dlFileEntryTypesSearchContainerPrimaryKeys - a comma-delimited list of file entry type primary keys allowed in the given folder and all descendants
  • restrictionType - specifying restriction type of file entry types allowed
  • workflowDefinitionXYZ - the workflow definition name specified per file entry type. The parameter name must be the string workflowDefinition appended by the fileEntryTypeId (optionally 0).

javadoc.name: DLFileEntryLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Provides the local service for accessing, adding, checking in/out, deleting, locking/unlocking, moving, reverting, updating, and verifying document library file entries.

Due to legacy code, the names of some file entry properties are not intuitive. Each file entry has both a name and title. The name is a unique identifier for a given file and is generally numeric, whereas the title is the actual name specified by the user (such as "Budget.xls").
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Harry Mark
Alexander Chow
Manuel de la Peña

javadoc.name: DDMStructureLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Provides the local service for accessing, adding, deleting, and updating dynamic data mapping (DDM) structures.

DDM structures (structures) are used in Liferay to store structured content like document types, dynamic data definitions, or web contents.

Structures support inheritance via parent structures. They also support multi-language names and descriptions.

Structures can be related to many models in Liferay, such as those for web contents, dynamic data lists, and documents. This relationship can be established via the model's class name ID.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Bruno Basto
Marcellus Tavares
Juan Fernández

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for the structure's related model

param.name: structureKey
param.comment: the unique string identifying the structure (optionally null)

param.name: nameMap
param.comment: the structure's locales and localized names

param.name: descriptionMap
param.comment: the structure's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: definition
param.comment: the structure's XML schema definition

param.name: storageType
param.comment: the structure's storage type. It can be "xml" or "expando". For more information, see {@link StorageType}.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Can set the UUID, creation date, modification date, guest permissions, and group permissions for the structure.

method.name: fetchStructure
method.comment:
Returns the structure matching the class name ID, structure key, and group, optionally searching ancestor sites (that have sharing enabled) and global scoped sites.

This method first searches in the group. If the structure is still not found and includeAncestorStructures is set to true, this method searches the group's ancestor sites (that have sharing enabled) and lastly searches global scoped sites.

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the structures matching the groups and class name IDs, and matching the keywords in the structure names and descriptions.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

method.name: getStructure
method.comment:
Returns the structure matching the class name ID, structure key, and group, optionally searching ancestor sites (that have sharing enabled) and global scoped sites.

This method first searches in the group. If the structure is still not found and includeAncestorStructures is set to true, this method searches the group's ancestor sites (that have sharing enabled) and lastly searches global scoped sites.

param.comment: whether to include ancestor sites (that have sharing enabled) and include global scoped sites in the search

return.comment: the matching structure

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the user did not have permission to view the structure or if a matching structure could not be found

javadoc.name: DDMTemplateLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Provides the local service for accessing, adding, copying, deleting, and updating dynamic data mapping (DDM) templates.

DDM templates (templates) are used in Liferay to render templated content like applications, forms, dynamic data lists, or web contents.

Templates support a variety of templating languages, like Velocity or FreeMarker. They also support multi-language names and descriptions.

Templates can be related to many models in Liferay, such as those for structures, dynamic data lists, and applications. This relationship can be established via the class name ID and class PK.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Eduardo Lundgren
Marcellus Tavares

method.name: addTemplate
method.comment: Adds a template.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the template's creator/owner

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for the template's related model

param.name: classPK
param.comment: the primary key of the template's related entity

param.name: resourceClassNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for template's resource model

param.name: nameMap
param.comment: the template's locales and localized names

param.name: descriptionMap
param.comment: the template's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: type
param.comment: the template's type. For more information, see {@link DDMTemplateConstants}.

param.name: mode
param.comment: the template's mode. For more information, see {@link DDMTemplateConstants}.

param.name: language
param.comment: the template's script language. For more information, see {@link DDMTemplateConstants}.

param.name: script
param.comment: the template's script

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Can set the UUID, creation date, modification date, guest permissions, and group permissions for the template.

return.comment: the template

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a portal exception occurred

method.name: fetchTemplate
method.comment:
Returns the template matching the group and template key, optionally searching ancestor sites (that have sharing enabled) and global scoped sites.

This method first searches in the given group. If the template is still not found and includeAncestorTemplates is set to true, this method searches the group's ancestor sites (that have sharing enabled) and lastly searches global scoped sites.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for the template's related model

param.name: templateKey
param.comment: the unique string identifying the template

param.name: includeAncestorTemplates
param.comment: whether to include ancestor sites (that have sharing enabled) and include global scoped sites in the search in the search

return.comment: the matching template, or null if a matching template could not be found

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a portal exception occurred

method.name: getTemplatesByStructureClassNameId
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the templates matching the group and structure class name ID.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: structureClassNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for the template's related structure

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of templates to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of templates to return (not inclusive)

param.name: orderByComparator
param.comment: the comparator to order the templates (optionally null)

return.comment: the range of matching templates ordered by the comparator

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the templates matching the group, class name ID, class PK, type, and mode, and matching the keywords in the template names and descriptions.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the template's company

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for the template's related model

param.name: classPK
param.comment: the primary key of the template's related entity

param.name: resourceClassNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for template's resource model

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the template's name or description (optionally null)

param.name: type
param.comment: the template's type (optionally null). For more information, see {@link DDMTemplateConstants}.

param.name: mode
param.comment: the template's mode (optionally null). For more information, see {@link DDMTemplateConstants}.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of templates to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of templates to return (not inclusive)

param.name: orderByComparator
param.comment: the comparator to order the templates (optionally null)

return.comment: the range of matching templates ordered by the comparator

javadoc.name: DDMTemplateServiceImpl
javadoc.comment: Provides the remote service for accessing, adding, copying, deleting, and updating dynamic data mapping (DDM) templates. Its methods include security checks.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Eduardo Lundgren
Marcellus Tavares

method.name: addTemplate
method.comment: Adds a template.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for template's related model

param.name: classPK
param.comment: the primary key of the template's related entity

param.name: resourceClassNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for template's resource model

param.name: nameMap
param.comment: the template's locales and localized names

param.name: descriptionMap
param.comment: the template's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: type
param.comment: the template's type. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portlet.dynamicdatamapping.model.DDMTemplateConstants}.

param.name: mode
param.comment: the template's mode. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portlet.dynamicdatamapping.model.DDMTemplateConstants}.

param.name: language
param.comment: the template's script language. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portlet.dynamicdatamapping.model.DDMTemplateConstants}.

param.name: script
param.comment: the template's script

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Must have the ddmResource attribute to check permissions. Can set the UUID, creation date, modification date, guest permissions, and group permissions for the template.

return.comment: the template

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the user did not have permission to add the template or if a portal exception occurred

param.name: language
param.comment: the template's script language. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portlet.dynamicdatamapping.model.DDMTemplateConstants}.

param.name: script
param.comment: the template's script

param.name: cacheable
param.comment: whether the template is cacheable

param.name: smallImage
param.comment: whether the template has a small image

param.name: smallImageURL
param.comment: the template's small image URL (optionally null)

param.name: smallImageFile
param.comment: the template's small image file (optionally null)

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Must have the ddmResource attribute to check permissions. Can set the UUID, creation date, modification date, guest permissions, and group permissions for the template.

method.name: copyTemplate
method.comment: Copies the template, creating a new template with all the values extracted from the original one. This method supports defining a new name and description.

param.name: templateId
param.comment: the primary key of the template to be copied

param.name: nameMap
param.comment: the new template's locales and localized names

param.name: descriptionMap
param.comment: the new template's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Must have the ddmResource attribute to check permissions. Can set the UUID, creation date, modification date, guest permissions, and group permissions for the template.

return.comment: the new template

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the user did not have permission to add the template or if a portal exception occurred

method.name: copyTemplates
method.comment: Copies all the templates matching the class name ID, class PK, and type. This method creates new templates, extracting all the values from the old ones and updating their class PKs.

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for template's related model

param.name: oldClassPK
param.comment: the primary key of the old template's related entity

param.name: resourceClassNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for template's resource model

param.name: newClassPK
param.comment: the primary key of the new template's related entity

param.name: type
param.comment: the template's type. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portlet.dynamicdatamapping.model.DDMTemplateConstants}.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Must have the ddmResource attribute to check permissions. Can set the UUID, creation date, modification date, guest permissions, and group permissions for the template.

return.comment: the new template

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the user did not have permission to add the template or if a portal exception occurred

method.name: deleteTemplate
method.comment: Deletes the template and its resources.

param.name: templateId

throws.name: PortalException

method.name: getTemplate
method.comment:
Returns the template matching the group and template key, optionally searching ancestor sites (that have sharing enabled) and global scoped sites.

This method first searches in the group. If the template is still not found and includeAncestorTemplates is set to true, this method searches the group's ancestor sites (that have sharing enabled) and lastly searches global scoped sites.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for template's related model

param.name: templateKey
param.comment: the unique string identifying the template

param.name: includeAncestorTemplates
param.comment: whether to include ancestor sites (that have sharing enabled) and include global scoped sites in the search

return.comment: the matching template

throws.name: PortalException

method.name: getTemplatesByStructureClassNameId
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the templates matching the group and structure class name ID and all the generic templates matching the group.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: structureClassNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for the template's related structure (optionally 0). Specify 0 to return generic templates only.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of templates to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of templates to return (not inclusive)

param.name: orderByComparator
param.comment: the comparator to order the templates (optionally null)

return.comment: the range of matching templates ordered by the comparator

method.name: getTemplatesByStructureClassNameIdCount
method.comment: Returns the number of templates matching the group and structure class name ID plus the number of generic templates matching the group.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: structureClassNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the class name for the template's related structure (optionally 0). Specify 0 to count generic templates only.

return.comment: the number of matching templates plus the number of matching generic templates

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the templates matching the group, class name ID, class PK, type, and mode, and matching the keywords in the template names and descriptions.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

javadoc.name: JournalArticleLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment: Provides the local service for accessing, adding, deleting, and updating web content articles.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Raymond Augé
Bruno Farache
Juan Fernández
Sergio González

method.name: addArticle

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's creator/owner

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's group

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article folder

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the DDMStructure class if the web content article is related to a DDM structure, the primary key of the class name associated with the article, or {@link JournalArticleConstants#CLASSNAME_ID_DEFAULT} otherwise

param.name: classPK
param.comment: the primary key of the DDM structure, if the primary key of the DDMStructure class is given as the classNameId parameter, the primary key of the class associated with the web content article, or 0 otherwise

param.name: articleId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article

param.name: autoArticleId
param.comment: whether to auto generate the web content article ID

param.name: version
param.comment: the web content article's version

param.name: titleMap
param.comment: the web content article's locales and localized titles

param.name: descriptionMap
param.comment: the web content article's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: content
param.comment: the HTML content wrapped in XML

param.name: ddmStructureKey
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's DDM structure, if the article is related to a DDM structure, or null otherwise

param.name: ddmTemplateKey
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's DDM template

param.name: layoutUuid
param.comment: the unique string identifying the web content article's display page

param.name: displayDateMonth
param.comment: the month the web content article is set to display

param.name: displayDateDay
param.comment: the calendar day the web content article is set to display

param.name: displayDateYear
param.comment: the year the web content article is set to display

param.name: displayDateHour
param.comment: the hour the web content article is set to display

param.name: displayDateMinute
param.comment: the minute the web content article is set to display

param.name: expirationDateMonth
param.comment: the month the web content article is set to expire

param.name: expirationDateDay
param.comment: the calendar day the web content article is set to expire

param.name: expirationDateYear
param.comment: the year the web content article is set to expire

param.name: expirationDateHour
param.comment: the hour the web content article is set to expire

param.name: expirationDateMinute
param.comment: the minute the web content article is set to expire

param.name: neverExpire
param.comment: whether the web content article is not set to auto expire

param.name: reviewDateMonth
param.comment: the month the web content article is set for review

param.name: reviewDateDay
param.comment: the calendar day the web content article is set for review

param.name: reviewDateYear
param.comment: the year the web content article is set for review

param.name: reviewDateHour
param.comment: the hour the web content article is set for review

param.name: reviewDateMinute
param.comment: the minute the web content article is set for review

param.name: neverReview
param.comment: whether the web content article is not set for review

param.name: indexable
param.comment: whether the web content article is searchable

param.name: smallImage
param.comment: whether the web content article has a small image

Can also set whether to add the default guest and group permissions.

param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's group

param.comment: the web content article's accessible URL

param.comment: the service context to be applied. Can set the modification date, status date, portlet preferences, and can set whether to add the default command update for the web content article. With respect to social activities, by setting the service context's command to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.Constants#UPDATE}, the invocation is considered a web content update activity; otherwise it is considered a web content add activity.

throws.comment: if a matching web content article could not be found or if a portal exception occurred

method.name: expireArticle
method.comment: Expires the web content article matching the group and article ID, expiring all of its versions if the journal.article.expire.all.versions portal property is true, otherwise expiring only its latest approved version.

param.comment: the service context to be applied. Can set the modification date, status date, portlet preferences, and can set whether to add the default command update for the web content article. With respect to social activities, by setting the service context's command to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.Constants#UPDATE}, the invocation is considered a web content update activity; otherwise it is considered a web content add activity.

throws.name: PortalException

method.comment: Returns a web content article display for the first page of the latest version of the web content article matching the group, article ID, and DDM template. Web content transformation tokens are added from the theme display (if not null).

param.name: languageId
param.comment: the primary key of the language translation to get

param.name: themeDisplay
param.comment: the theme display

return.comment: the web content article display, or null if the article has expired or if article's display date/time is after the current date/time

throws.name: PortalException

method.name: getArticles
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the web content articles belonging to the group.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's group

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of web content articles to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of web content articles to return (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of matching web content articles

method.name: moveArticleFromTrash
method.comment: Moves the web content article from the Recycle Bin to a new folder.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user updating the web content article

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's group

param.name: article
param.comment: the web content article

param.name: newFolderId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's new folder

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Can set the modification date, portlet preferences, and can set whether to add the default command update for the web content article. With respect to social activities, by setting the service context's command to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.Constants#UPDATE}, the invocation is considered a web content update activity; otherwise it is considered a web content add activity.

return.comment: the updated web content article, which was moved from the Recycle Bin to a new folder

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a trashed web content article with the primary key could not be found or if a portal exception occurred

param.comment: the web content article

return.comment: the updated web content article, which was moved to the Recycle Bin

method.name: rebuildTree
method.comment:
Rebuilds the web content article's tree path using tree traversal.

For example, here is a conceptualization of a web content article tree path: 


/(Folder's folderId)/(Subfolder's folderId)/(article's articleId)

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's company

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a portal exception occurred

throws.comment: if the web content article with the primary key could not be found in the Recycle Bin, if the user did not have permission to restore the article, or if a portal exception occurred

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the web content articles matching the parameters without using the indexer. It is preferable to use the indexed version {@link #search(long, long, long, int, int, int)} instead of this method wherever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group (optionally 0)

param.name: folderIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the web content article folders (optionally {@link java.util.Collections#EMPTY_LIST})

param.name: status
param.comment: the web content article's workflow status. For more information see {@link WorkflowConstants} for constants starting with the "STATUS_" prefix.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of web content articles to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of web content articles to return (not inclusive)

return.comment: the matching web content articles

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the web content articles matching the parameters without using the indexer, including a keywords parameter for matching with the article's ID, title, description, and content, a DDM structure key parameter, and a DDM template key parameter. It is preferable to use the indexed version {@link #search(long, long, List, long, String, String, String, LinkedHashMap, int, int, Sort)} instead of this method wherever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the web content articles matching the parameters using the indexer, including a keywords parameter for matching an article's ID, title, description, or content, a DDM structure key parameter, a DDM template key parameter, and a finder hash map parameter. It is preferable to use this method instead of the non-indexed version whenever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: ddmStructureKey
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's DDM structure, if the article is related to a DDM structure, or null otherwise

param.name: ddmTemplateKey
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's DDM template

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the web content article ID, title, description, or content (optionally null). If the keywords value is not null, the search uses the OR operator in connecting query criteria; otherwise it uses the AND operator.

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder parameters (optionally null)

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of web content articles to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of web content articles to return (not inclusive)

param.name: sort
param.comment: the field, type, and direction by which to sort (optionally null)

method.name: searchJournalArticles
method.comment:
Returns a {@link BaseModelSearchResult} containing the total number of hits and an ordered range of all the web content articles matching the parameters using the indexer, including a keywords parameter for matching an article's ID, title, description, or content, a DDM structure key parameter, a DDM template key parameter, and a finder hash map parameter. It is preferable to use this method instead of the non-indexed version whenever possible for performance reasons.

The start and end parameters only affect the amount of web content articles returned as results, not the total number of hits.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's company

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group (optionally 0)

param.name: folderIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the web content article folders (optionally {@link java.util.Collections#EMPTY_LIST})

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the DDMStructure class, the primary key of the class name associated with the article, or {@link JournalArticleConstants#CLASSNAME_ID_DEFAULT} otherwise

param.name: ddmStructureKey
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's DDM structure

param.name: ddmTemplateKey
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's DDM template

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the web content article ID, title, description, or content (optionally null). If the keywords value is not null, the search uses the OR operator in connecting query criteria; otherwise it uses the AND operator.

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder parameters (optionally null)

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of web content articles to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of web content articles to return (not inclusive)

param.name: sort
param.comment: the field, type, and direction by which to sort (optionally null)

return.comment: a {@link BaseModelSearchResult} containing the total number of hits and an ordered range of all the matching web content articles ordered by sort

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a portal exception occurred

method.name: searchJournalArticles
method.comment:
Returns a {@link BaseModelSearchResult} containing the total number of hits and an ordered range of all the web content articles matching the parameters using the indexer, including the web content article's creator ID and status. It is preferable to use this method instead of the non-indexed version whenever possible for performance reasons.

The start and end parameters only affect the amount of web content articles returned as results, not the total number of hits.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group (optionally 0)

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user searching for web content articles

param.name: creatorUserId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's creator

param.name: status
param.comment: the web content article's workflow status. For more information see {@link WorkflowConstants} for constants starting with the "STATUS_" prefix.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of web content articles to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of web content articles to return (not inclusive)

return.comment: a {@link BaseModelSearchResult} containing the total number of hits and an ordered range of all the matching web content articles ordered by sort

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a portal exception occurred

param.name: groupId

param.comment: the primary key of the web content article

param.name: version
param.comment: the web content article's version

param.name: titleMap
param.comment: the web content article's locales and localized titles

Can set the modification date, expando bridge attributes, asset category IDs, asset tag names, asset link entry IDs, workflow actions, the and "urlTitle" attributes, and can set whether to add the default command update for the web content article. With respect to social activities, by setting the service context's command to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.Constants#UPDATE}, the invocation is considered a web content update activity; otherwise it is considered a web content add activity.

method.name: getArticles
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the web content articles matching the group and folder.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's group

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article folder

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of web content articles to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of web content articles to return (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the web content articles

return.comment: the matching web content articles

Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's group

param.name: articleId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of web content articles to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of web content articles to return (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the web content articles

return.comment: the range of matching web content articles ordered by the comparator

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the web content articles matching the group, creator, creator, and workflow status using the indexer. It is preferable to use this method instead of the non-indexed version whenever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's group

param.name: creatorUserId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's creator

param.name: status
param.comment: the web content article's workflow status. For more information see {@link WorkflowConstants} for constants starting with the "STATUS_" prefix.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of web content articles to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of web content articles to return (not inclusive)

return.comment: the matching web content articles

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a portal exception occurred

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the web content articles matching the parameters, including a keywords parameter for matching with the article's ID, title, description, and content, a DDM structure key parameter, and a DDM template key parameter.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's company

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group (optionally 0)

param.name: folderIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the web content article folders (optionally {@link java.util.Collections#EMPTY_LIST})

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the DDMStructure class if the web content article is related to a DDM structure, the primary key of the class name associated with the article, or {@link JournalArticleConstants#CLASSNAME_ID_DEFAULT} otherwise

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the web content article ID, title, description, or content (optionally null). If the keywords value is not null, the search uses the OR operator in connecting query criteria; otherwise it uses the AND operator.

param.name: version
param.comment: the web content article's version (optionally null)

param.name: ddmStructureKey
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's DDM structure, if the article is related to a DDM structure, or null otherwise

param.name: ddmTemplateKey
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's DDM template

param.name: displayDateGT
param.comment: the date after which a matching web content article's display date must be after (optionally null)

param.name: displayDateLT
param.comment: the date before which a matching web content article's display date must be before (optionally null)

param.name: status
param.comment: the web content article's workflow status. For more information see {@link WorkflowConstants} for constants starting with the "STATUS_" prefix.

param.name: reviewDate
param.comment: the web content article's scheduled review date (optionally null)

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of web content articles to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of web content articles to return (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the web content articles

return.comment: the range of matching web content articles ordered by the comparator

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the web content articles matching the parameters, including keyword parameters for article ID, title, description, and content, a DDM structure key parameter, a DDM template key parameter, and an AND operator switch.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's company

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group (optionally 0)

param.name: folderIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the web content article folders (optionally {@link java.util.Collections#EMPTY_LIST})

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the DDMStructure class if the web content article is related to a DDM structure, the primary key of the class name associated with the article, or {@link JournalArticleConstants#CLASSNAME_ID_DEFAULT} otherwise

param.name: articleId
param.comment: the article ID keywords (space separated, optionally null)

param.name: version
param.comment: the web content article's version (optionally null)

param.name: title
param.comment: the title keywords (space separated, optionally null)

param.name: description
param.comment: the description keywords (space separated, optionally null)

param.name: content
param.comment: the content keywords (space separated, optionally null)

param.name: ddmStructureKey
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's DDM structure, if the article is related to a DDM structure, or null otherwise

param.name: ddmTemplateKey
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's DDM template

param.name: displayDateGT
param.comment: the date after which a matching web content article's display date must be after (optionally null)

param.name: displayDateLT
param.comment: the date before which a matching web content article's display date must be before (optionally null)

param.name: status
param.comment: the web content article's workflow status. For more information see {@link WorkflowConstants} for constants starting with the "STATUS_" prefix.

param.name: reviewDate
param.comment: the web content article's scheduled review date (optionally null)

param.name: andOperator
param.comment: whether every field must match its value or keywords, or just one field must match. Company, group, folder IDs, class name ID, and status must all match their values.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of web content articles to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of web content articles to return (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the web content articles

return.comment: the range of matching web content articles ordered by the comparator

method.name: updateArticle
method.comment: Updates the web content article matching the version, replacing its folder, title, description, content, and layout UUID.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user updating the web content article

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article's group

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article folder

param.name: articleId
param.comment: the primary key of the web content article

param.name: version
param.comment: the web content article's version

param.name: titleMap
param.comment: the web content article's locales and localized titles

param.name: descriptionMap
param.comment: the web content article's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: content
param.comment: the HTML content wrapped in XML. For more information, see the content example in the {@link #updateArticle(long, long, String, double, String, ServiceContext)} description.

param.name: layoutUuid
param.comment: the unique string identifying the web content article's display page

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied. Can set the modification date, expando bridge attributes, asset category IDs, asset tag names, asset link entry IDs, workflow actions, the and "urlTitle" attributes, and can set whether to add the default command update for the web content article. With respect to social activities, by setting the service context's command to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.Constants#UPDATE}, the invocation is considered a web content update activity; otherwise it is considered a web content add activity.

return.comment: the updated web content article

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a user with the primary key or a matching web content article could not be found, or if a portal exception occurred

param.comment: the web content article's small image URL (optionally null)

param.comment: the web content article's new small image file (optionally null). Must pass in smallImage value of true to replace the article's small image file.

param.name: images
param.comment: the web content's images (optionally null)

param.name: articleURL
param.comment: the web content article's accessible URL (optionally null)

param.name: serviceContext

With respect to social activities, by setting the service context's command to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.Constants#UPDATE}, the invocation is considered a web content update activity; otherwise it is considered a web content add activity.

return.comment: the updated web content article

throws.name: PortalException

javadoc.name: SocialActivityCounterLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
The social activity counter local service. This service is responsible for creating and/or incrementing counters in response to an activity. It also provides methods for querying activity counters within a time period.

Under normal circumstances only the {@link #addActivityCounters(SocialActivity)} should be called directly and even that is usually not necessary as it is automatically called by the social activity service.
javadoc.author: Zsolt Berentey
Shuyang Zhou

method.name: addActivityCounter
method.comment:
Adds an activity counter with a default period length.

This method uses the lock service to guard against multiple threads trying to insert the same counter because this service is called asynchronously from the social activity service.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the entity's class this counter belongs to

param.name: classPK
param.comment: the primary key of the entity this counter belongs to

param.name: name
param.comment: the counter's name

param.name: ownerType
param.comment: the counter's owner type. Acceptable values are TYPE_ACTOR, TYPE_ASSET and TYPE_CREATOR defined in {@link SocialActivityCounterConstants}.

param.name: currentValue
param.comment: the counter's current value (optionally 0)

param.name: totalValue
param.comment: the counter's total value (optionally 0)

param.name: startPeriod
param.comment: the counter's start period

param.name: endPeriod
param.comment: the counter's end period

return.comment: the added activity counter

method.deprecated: As of 6.2.0, replaced by {@link #addActivityCounter(long, long, long, String, int, int, long, int)}

method.name: addActivityCounter
method.comment:
Adds an activity counter specifying a previous activity and period length.

This method uses the lock service to guard against multiple threads trying to insert the same counter because this service is called asynchronously from the social activity service.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the primary key of the entity's class this counter belongs to

param.name: classPK
param.comment: the primary key of the entity this counter belongs to

param.name: name
param.comment: the counter name

param.name: ownerType
param.comment: the counter's owner type. Acceptable values are TYPE_ACTOR, TYPE_ASSET and TYPE_CREATOR defined in {@link SocialActivityCounterConstants}.

param.name: currentValue
param.comment: the current value of the counter (optionally 0)

method.name: addActivityCounters
method.comment:
Adds or increments activity counters related to an activity.

This method is called asynchronously from the social activity service when the user performs an activity defined in liferay-social.xml.

This method first calls the activity processor class, if there is one defined for the activity, checks for limits and increments all the counters that belong to the activity. Afterwards, it processes the activity with respect to achievement classes, if any. Lastly it increments the built-in user.activities and asset.activities counters.

param.name: activity
param.comment: the social activity

javadoc.name: SocialActivityInterpreterLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
The social activity interpreter local service. Activity interpreters are classes responsible for translating activity records into human readable form. This service holds a list of interpreters and provides methods to add or remove items from this list.

Activity interpreters use the language files to get text fragments based on the activity's type and the type of asset on which the activity was done. Interpreters are created for specific asset types and are only capable of translating activities done on assets of those types. As an example, there is an interpreter BlogsActivityInterpreter that can only translate activity records for blog entries.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan

method.name: addActivityInterpreter
method.comment: Adds the activity interpreter to the list of available interpreters.

param.name: activityInterpreter

method.name: deleteActivityInterpreter

param.name: activityInterpreter

method.name: interpret
method.comment:
Creates a human readable activity feed entry for the activity using an available compatible activity interpreter.

This method finds the appropriate interpreter for the activity by going through the available interpreters and asking them if they can handle the asset type of the activity.

param.name: selector
param.comment: the context in which the activity interpreter is used

param.name: activity
param.comment: the activity to be translated to human readable form

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied

return.comment: the activity feed that is a human readable form of the activity record or null if a compatible interpreter is not found

javadoc.name: SocialActivityLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
The social activity local service. This service provides the means to record and list social activities in groups and organizations.

Social activities are identified by their type and the type of asset they are done on. Each activity records the exact time of the action as well as human readable information needed for activity feeds.

Most of the get- methods in this service order activities in descending order by their execution times, so the most recent activities are listed first.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan

method.name: addActivity
method.comment:
Records an activity with the given time in the database.

This method records a social activity done on an asset, identified by its class name and class primary key, in the database. Additional information (such as the original message ID for a reply to a forum post) is passed in via the extraData in JSON format. For activities affecting another user, a mirror activity is generated that describes the action from the user's point of view. The target user's ID is passed in via the receiverUserId.

Example for a mirrored activity:
When a user replies to a message boards post, the reply action is stored in the database with the receiverUserId being the ID of the author of the original message. The extraData contains the ID of the original message in JSON format. A mirror activity is generated with the values of the userId and the receiverUserId swapped. This mirror activity basically describes a "replied to" event.

Mirror activities are most often used in relation to friend requests and activities.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the acting user

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.comment: the activity's date

param.comment: the primary key of the target asset

param.name: type
param.comment: the activity's type

param.name: extraData
param.comment: any extra data regarding the activity

param.name: receiverUserId
param.comment: the primary key of the receiving user

javadoc.name: SocialRelationLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
The social relation local service. This service provides methods to handle unidirectional or bidirectional relations between users.

Relations between users can be unidirectional or bidirectional. The type of relation is determined by an integer constant. Some example relations are co-worker, friend, romantic partner, sibling, spouse, child, enemy, follower, parent, subordinate, supervisor.

The two users participating in the relation are designated as User1 and User2. In case of unidirectional relations User1 should always be the subject of the relation. You can use the following English sentence to find out which user to use as User1 and which to use as User2:

User1 is <relation> of User2 (e.g. User1 is parent of User2; User1 is supervisor of User2)

For bidirectional relations, the service automatically generates the inverse relation.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan

method.name: addRelation
method.comment: Adds a social relation between the two users to the database.

param.name: userId1
param.comment: the user that is the subject of the relation

param.name: userId2
param.comment: the user at the other end of the relation

param.name: type
param.comment: the type of the relation

return.comment: the social relation

method.comment: Removes the relation (and its inverse in case of a bidirectional relation) from the database.

param.name: relationId
param.comment: the primary key of the relation

method.comment: Removes the matching relation (and its inverse in case of a bidirectional relation) from the database.

param.name: userId1

param.name: userId2
param.comment: the user at the other end of the relation

param.name: type
param.comment: the relation's type

Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

method.name: isRelatable
method.comment:
Returns true if the users can be in a relation of the given type where the user with primary key userId1 is User1 of the relation and the user with the primary key userId2 is User2 of the relation.

This method returns false if User1 and User2 are the same, if either user is the default user, or if a matching relation already exists.

param.name: userId1
param.comment: the user that is the subject of the relation

param.name: userId2
param.comment: the user at the other end of the relation

param.name: type
param.comment: the relation's type

return.comment: true if the two users can be in a new relation of the given type; false otherwise

javadoc.name: SocialRequestInterpreterLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
The social request interpreter local service. Social request interpreters are responsible for translating social requests into human readable form as well as handling social request confirmations and rejections. This service holds a list of interpreters and provides methods to add or remove items from this list.

Social request interpreters use the language files to get text fragments based on the request's type. An interpreter is created for a specific request type and is only capable of handling requests of that type. As an example, there is an interpreter FriendsRequestInterpreter in the social networking portlet can only translate and handle interpretation, confirmation, and rejection of friend requests.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan

method.name: addRequestInterpreter
method.comment: Adds the social request interpreter to the list of available interpreters.

param.name: requestInterpreter
param.comment: the social request interpreter

method.name: deleteRequestInterpreter
method.comment: Removes the social request interpreter from the list of available interpreters.

param.name: requestInterpreter
param.comment: the social request interpreter

method.name: interpret
method.comment:
Creates a human readable request feed entry for the social request using an available compatible request interpreter.

This method finds the appropriate interpreter for the request by going through the available interpreters to find one that can handle the asset type of the request.

param.name: request
param.comment: the social request to be translated to human readable form

param.name: themeDisplay
param.comment: the theme display needed by interpreters to create links and get localized text fragments

return.comment: the social request feed entry

method.name: processConfirmation
method.comment:
Processes the confirmation of the social request.

Confirmations are handled by finding the appropriate social request interpreter and calling its processConfirmation() method. To find the appropriate interpreter this method goes through the available interpreters to find one that can handle the asset type of the request.

param.name: request
param.comment: the social request being confirmed

param.name: themeDisplay
param.comment: the theme display needed by interpreters to create links and get localized text fragments

method.name: processRejection
method.comment:
Processes the rejection of the social request.

Rejections are handled by finding the appropriate social request interpreters and calling their processRejection() methods. To find the appropriate interpreters this method goes through the available interpreters and asks them if they can handle the asset type of the request.

param.name: request
param.comment: the social request being rejected

param.name: themeDisplay
param.comment: the theme display needed by interpreters to create links and get localized text fragments

javadoc.name: SocialRequestLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment: The social request local service responsible for handling social requests (e.g. friend requests).
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan

method.name: addRequest
method.comment:
Adds a social request to the database.

In order to add a social request, both the requesting user and the receiving user must be from the same company and neither of them can be the default user.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the requesting user

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: className
param.comment: the class name of the asset that is the subject of the request

param.name: classPK
param.comment: the primary key of the asset that is the subject of the request

param.name: type
param.comment: the request's type

param.name: extraData
param.comment: the extra data regarding the request

param.name: receiverUserId
param.comment: the primary key of the user receiving the request

return.comment: the social request

method.name: getReceiverUserRequests
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the social requests for the receiving user.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: receiverUserId
param.comment: the primary key of the receiving user

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of results

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of results (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of matching social requests

method.name: getReceiverUserRequests
method.comment:

Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.comment: the upper bound of the range of results (not inclusive)

method.name: updateRequest
method.comment:
Updates the social request replacing its status.

If the status is updated to {@link SocialRequestConstants#STATUS_CONFIRM} then {@link com.liferay.portlet.social.service.SocialRequestInterpreterLocalService#processConfirmation(SocialRequest, ThemeDisplay)} is called. If the status is updated to {@link SocialRequestConstants#STATUS_IGNORE} then {@link com.liferay.portlet.social.service.SocialRequestInterpreterLocalService#processRejection(SocialRequest, ThemeDisplay)} is called.

param.name: requestId
param.comment: the primary key of the social request

param.name: status
param.comment: the new status

param.name: themeDisplay
param.comment: the theme display

return.comment: the updated social request

method.name: moveEntry
method.comment:
Moves the trash entry with the entity class name and primary key, restoring it to a new location identified by the destination container model ID.

This method throws a {@link TrashPermissionException} if the user did not have the permission to perform one of the necessary operations. The exception is created with a type specific to the operation:

  • {@link TrashPermissionException#MOVE} - if the user did not have permission to move the trash entry to the new destination
  • {@link TrashPermissionException#RESTORE} - if the user did not have permission to restore the trash entry

param.name: className
param.comment: the class name of the entity

param.name: classPK
param.comment: the primary key of the entity

param.name: destinationContainerModelId
param.comment: the primary key of the new location

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied (optionally null)

method.name: restoreEntry
method.comment:
Restores the trash entry to its original location. In order to handle a duplicate trash entry already existing at the original location, either pass in the primary key of the existing trash entry's entity to overwrite or pass in a new name to give to the trash entry being restored.

This method throws a {@link TrashPermissionException} if the user did not have the permission to perform one of the necessary operations. The exception is created with a type specific to the operation:

  • {@link TrashPermissionException#RESTORE} - if the user did not have permission to restore the trash entry
  • {@link TrashPermissionException#RESTORE_OVERWRITE} - if the user did not have permission to delete the existing trash entry
  • {@link TrashPermissionException#RESTORE_RENAME} - if the user did not have permission to rename the trash entry

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the trash entry to restore

param.name: overrideClassPK
param.comment: the primary key of the entity to overwrite (optionally 0)

param.name: name
param.comment: a new name to give to the trash entry being restored (optionally null)

return.comment: the restored trash entry
